summary: The American Cybersecurity Literacy Act aims to establish a national cybersecurity literacy campaign. The Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information is tasked with developing and conducting a multi-language campaign to educate the public on cybersecurity best practices. This includes identifying and mitigating risks like phishing, insecure websites, and vulnerabilities in commonly used devices. The campaign will also promote the use of cybersecurity tools and encourage safe online behavior to protect against cyberattacks.
